    Computes spatial empirical means

    spatial_means.Rd

    This function computes spatial empirical means by latitude and longitude averaged over time.

    spatial_means(x, lat_col, lon_col, t_col, z_col)

    Arguments

    x

    A stars object or a dataframe. Arguments differ according to the input type.

    lat_col

    The column or the column name giving the latitude. The y coordinate can be used instead of latitude.

    lon_col

    The column or the column name giving the longitude. The x coordinate can be used instead of longitude.

    t_col

    The time column. Time must be a set of discrete integer values.

    z_col

    The The quantity of interest that will be plotted. Eg. temperature.

    Examples

    data(NOAA_df_1990)
library(dplyr)
Tmax <- filter(NOAA_df_1990,                      # subset the data
              proc == "Tmax" &                   # extract max temperature
                month %in% 5:9 &                 # May to July
                year == 1993)                    # year 1993
Tmax$t <- Tmax$julian - min(Tmax$julian) + 1      # create a new time variable starting at 1
spatial_means(Tmax,
       lat_col = "lat",
       lon_col = "lon",
       t_col = "t",
       z_col = "z")
#> Error in df[, lat_col]: object of type 'closure' is not subsettable
